result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin D Blanchard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Conditions: Become involved in counseling program as soon as possible. Successfully complete anger management & domestic abuse counseling.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to serve six months jail; remaining six months stayed, to be used at agent's discretion. Huber granted under jail rules.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Cases called: 14CF289, 14CF402, 14C327, 14CF328,  Defendant Justin D Blanchard in court, in custody, with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI addressed. Sentencing statements made by the parties. Court addressed defendant regarding sentencing.  In 14CF289, Court withheld sentence, placed defendant on 3 yrs. probation, conds: 1 year jail - serve six months, starting 9/1/15. Huber granted for work and counseling sessions. Remaining six months stayed - to be used at agent's discretion. $618 costs, Further conds: Become involved in counseling program as soon as possible. Successfully complete anger management & domestic abuse counseling.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. (3 days jail credit).  In 14CF327, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, conds. as in 14CF289 with exception of jail and DNA sample, $543 costs. (86 days jail credit)  In 14CF328, sentence withheld, 3 yr. probation, same conds. as in 14CF327, $618 costs (86 days jail credit)  In 14CF402, sentence withheld, 3 yr. probation, same conds. as in 14CF327 $618 costs (9 days jail credit).

Cases heard: 14CF289, 14CF327, 14CF328, 14CF402, Defendant Justin D Blanchard in court, in custody with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waivers of Preliminary Hearings filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Informations filed. In 14CF327 & 14CF328, Atty. Klopp motioned for reduction of cash bonds and removal of no contact with E.U. Statement given by victim. DA Kohlwey objected to motion. Court amended bonds to $2,000 each case for a total of $4,000. No contact continued.  Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
